content: Hi All, Is there a build setting to auto-update the date element of IG resources? Seems like it might be useful.
doesn't look like it. Sounds like a good idea though
I hesitate a bit, because I can imagine not wanting examples updated, or specific resources, but we apply version across all resources, so it seems to be analogous.
right. it's not going to be automatic, but a build parameter... sure
By the way, in case you missed this buried in thread: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation/topic/IG.20Release.20Publication.20procedure/near/267636105. Just to let you know.
is that an actual problem? That whole thread is so full of confusion about what's going on that I'm discounting any details right now

It's an actual confusing message in the build output. I don't think it has anything to do with the main discussion of that thread, but I commented because @Jens Villadsen mentioned it. I called it out to you because, yes, there's a lot of other things going on there.
well, I mean, it looked like an invalid jurisdiction - so is it an actual problem?

The same goes for https://github.com/hl7dk/dk-core/blob/4216254684cec264a1d61a8189244017f67dff08/sushi-config.yaml#L21. - while Denmark (DK) is small in many aspects, it is usually considered a sovereign state and country :grinning:
